meanings.definition: The writing of the lives of saints.
meanings.sent1: Hagiographies tell stories about holy people.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient texts are hagiographies of saints.
meanings.sent3: The library had a whole section dedicated to hagiographies; it was like a treasure trove of saintly tales.
meanings.sent4: Her life was a hagiography, with every action seeming divinely inspired.
meanings.sent5: In the dim candlelight, the hagiographies seemed to come alive, painting a vivid picture of piety.

meanings.definition: Biographies of saints or venerated individuals.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a special section for hagiographies of revered figures.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study hagiographies to learn about the lives of saints.
meanings.sent3: Reading hagiographies feels like peeking into the past to witness the deeds of the holy.
meanings.sent4: Her bookshelf was filled with hagiographies, each one a window into a saint's life.
meanings.sent5: The hagiographies painted a colorful portrait of the revered individuals, making their stories unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A biography that idealizes its subject.
meanings.sent1: The author wrote a hagiography of the leader, portraying them as flawless.
meanings.sent2: Some critics argue that the biography was more of a hagiography than an accurate account.
meanings.sent3: The hagiography was so glowing that it almost seemed like a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: In the hagiography, the subject's every flaw was polished away, leaving only perfection.
meanings.sent5: The hagiography read like a love letter to the subject, highlighting only their virtues.
